Nutzen Sie das integrierte elektronische:
Use the integrated electronic voting system: Define the user group entitled to vote. Only participants set to present and set as eligible to vote in OpenSlides can vote. You can have nominal or non-nominal votes on motions, elections and polls. With OpenSlides, legally secure, secret ballots are possible. A legal opinion is available

Test electronic voting in the Online-Demo.
rechtssichere Antragsabstimmungen (Ja/Ne: legally binding voting on motions (Yes/No/Abstain) and elections (1-in-n or n-in-m) possible

Integrieren Sie einen Video-Livestream I:
Integrate a live video stream of your virtual meeting in OpenSlides. All participants can follow the stream in OpenSlides at any time. If a person wants to speak, they are automatically added to the current speaking list in OpenSlides and thus automatically switch to a Jitsi video conference room. The livestream broadcasts the video conference. At the end of the speech, one leaves the conference room and follows the livestream again.

This method is very bandwidth-efficient (compared to pure videoconferencing) and allows a large scaling of participant numbers. Virtual events with several hundred people are no longer a problem. In addition, most participants only "consume" an event, i.e. only a small group of people actively speak with microphone and camera. Rely on a proven broadcast streaming solution – intelligently coupled with the OpenSlides speakers list function.

Functionality in short animation: Video live stream
Anzeige des Livesstreams im Vordergrund: The livestream is always in the foreground (alternatively minimized or in full screen)
Automatische Übertragung des aktuellen R: automatic broadcasting of current speakers in the livestream
intelligente Koppelung mit der Redeliste: intelligent coupling with the speaker list (only persons on the list of speakers can enter the video conference)

OpenSlides ist Freie Open Source Softwar: OpenSlides is Free Open Source Software and was founded in 2011 by Emanuel Schütze, Oskar Hahn and Norman Jäckel. Until today, the 3 founders are responsible for the further development and, together with Intevation GmbH, have built up a Free Software initiative as well as a professional service offering around OpenSlides.
Verantwortlich für den Inhalt dieser Sei: Responsible for the content of this site:
OpenSlides ist eine leistungsstarke und: OpenSlides is a powerful and modern, web-based software for the digital organization of your meetings and committees. All user access their committees and meetings via one central URL.
Veranstaltungsorganisation aus einer Han: Meeting organization all from one source: agenda, speaker lists, motions, elections and participant administration.
Nutzen Sie die neuen Gremienmanagement-F: Use the new committee management functions of OpenSlides4 to digitize your organization sustainably. All of this can be used intuitively.
Verschlanken und vereinfachen Sie Ihre A: Streamline and simplify your processes at classic face-to-face events and let the benefits convince you: Respond flexibly in real time with OpenSlides and modernize your processes.
Geben Sie einem dezentral verteilten Ple: Give a decentrally distributed assembly the opportunity for interactive participation: All functions of OpenSlides can be controlled and used from home as well as at the venue. Hybrid - the format of the future!
Der integrierte Livestream macht OpenSli: The integrated livestream makes OpenSlides the complete solution for your digital event. The intelligent coupling of speaker list, video conference and livestream makes it easy to use. Virtual makes you independent.
Bilden Sie Ihre Gremienstrukturen ab, in: Map your organisations' structure by creating as many committees and meetings as needed. Determine exactly which committees can forward motions and define rights to access to committees and meetings. Archive your past meetings.
Der Autopilot führt alle Teilnehmenden d: The autopilot guides all participants through an event. It shows which agenda item or motion is currently being discussed, who is on the speaking list, which vote is currently in progress and what is currently being shown on the projector.
Ergänzen, ändern oder verschieben Sie au: Add, change, or move automatically numbered agenda items on the fly using drag and drop. Link individual items to speech lists as well as speaking times and integrate hidden entries such as breaks for better scheduling.
Erfassen Sie Anträge und Änderungsanträg: Enter motions and amendments. Assign categories and motion numbers. Vote electronically and record the decision.
Stellen Sie Kandidierende on-the-fly auf: Nominate candidates on-the-fly, speed up your ballots with electronic voting, and present the results.
Nutzen Sie Live-Voting für Antragsabstim: Use live voting for motion voting, elections and polling. Specify user group eligible to vote. Create nominal or non-nominal votes.
Bestimmen Sie, welche Personen was sehen: Determine which partcipants see what. Each area of OpenSlides can be enabled for individual user groups. Managing delegates and their attendance, as well as sophisticated rights management, is straightforward and intuitive.
OpenSlides ist für die Arbeit mit multip: OpenSlides is designed to work with multiple screens and comes with powerful projector controls. The web interface allows you to project and edit slides while the projectors are running in full screen.
Integrieren Sie einen Video-Livestream i: Integrate a live video stream in OpenSlides. All participants can follow this stream visibly in OpenSlides at any time and have the option of submitting speech contributions via a video conference.
Egal ob Dateiablage oder Kommentarfunkti: No matter if file upload or comment function – OpenSlides is equipped with a multitude of practicable tools. Moreover, we develop custom solutions for our clients.
Sie wollen OpenSlides für ihre nächste V: You want to use OpenSlides for your next assembly, but don't want to care about the technical details? Order a hosting package!
Sie benötigen individuellen Support vor: You need individual support at your assembly and professional consultation from the OpenSlides developers? You're missing a function or you want something changed? Arrange an initial consultation now! Our chargeable services:
Sie möchten OpenSlides auf Ihrem eigenen: You want to install OpenSlides on your own server? We offer our software as Open Source code. Please note that we cannot offer technical support for the installation and configuration on your own server.
Wir haben uns zu den Grundsätzen eines q: We pledged ourselves to the principles of a Open Source, liberal and free of charge exchange of our software and even represent this in our name. OpenSlides is usable under the MIT license. Help us to further improve the code.

Online-Versammlungen mit OpenSlides effi: Efficiently organize online meetings with OpenSlides
In Zeiten der COVID-19-Pandemie können v: In times of the COVID-19 pandemic, many meetings and assemblies of organizations cannot take place as usual. For example, general meetings of associations, general meetings of companies, general meetings of cooperatives and foundations, flat owners' meetings and various meetings of boards of directors and other bodies.
Um Abhilfe zu schaffen wurde von Bundesr: In order to remedy this situation, the Bundesrat and Bundestag passed a new law in Germany at the end of March 2020 to enable virtual meetings to be held. We have highlighted the legal aspects and innovations in a separate article and described minimum technical requirements for communication.
In diesem Artikel wird beschrieben, wie: This article describes how OpenSlides can be used to efficiently support virtual meetings. A core advantage of OpenSlides should be mentioned first: The virtual projector, which is available to all participants of a meeting and thus provides a good visual orientation for following the event. A list of speakers, agenda items, motions and much more can be displayed on the projector.
Eine zentrale Bedeutung bei virtuellen V: Attendance determination plays a central role in virtual meetings. For example, only users who are present may vote. With OpenSlides a virtual attendance list can be maintained. All participants receive personal access to OpenSlides and can register as "present" at the beginning of the meeting. This is comparable to entering a real attendance list. For members, registering in the list is just a simple click on "Present" (as marked in the following figure):
Im Sinne einer doppelten Absicherung kan: In the sense of a double safeguard, the meeting chair can view the attendance list at the beginning of the virtual meeting and check which members are already registered as present. Alternatively, it would also be possible for the session chairperson to completely take over the checking and marking of attendance.
Wortmeldungen in Redelisten organisieren: Organizing requests to speak in speech lists
Virtuelle Sitzungen können bereits in kl: Virtual sessions without moderation can quickly become stressful and chaotic even in small number. List of speakers help to get structure in. In OpenSlides, participants can set themselves on the list of speakers with just one click. Each item on the agenda and each motion has its own list of speakers. This allows members to register in advance to speak on specific agenda items/proposals.
Die Redeliste zur aktuellen Debatte läss: The list of speakers on the current debate can be displayed on a virtual projector, if desired with a countdown to limit the speaking time.
Die Sitzungsleitung steuert das Starten: The session host controls the starting and stopping of the contributions in OpenSlides. It is also possible to withdraw or move speakers in the list. We are currently working on an integration of the audio/video conferencing solution Jitsi into OpenSlides.
Das Herzstück von OpenSlides ist die dig: The core of OpenSlides is the digital motion management. Very complex processes from the application to the decision can be modelled. Even draft resolutions in meetings can be comfortably organized in OpenSlides. In this article only the most important application functions are mentioned.
Die Antragsliste bietet einen strukturie: The motion list provides a structured overview of all available motions and their status. A click opens a motion with all detailed information. Participants can read proposed changes and justifications and follow the appropriate list of speakers. It is also possible to make personal notes on each motion. A complete book of motions can be generated as a PDF file at any time, e.g. to create a finished book of resolutions at the end.
Jeder antragsberechtigte Teilnehmende ka: Every eligible participant can submit a motion independently in OpenSlides. All you have to do is entering the title of the proposal and the text to be decided on, optionally a justification. The application form is kept very simple:
Zu einem bestehenden Antrag lassen sich: It is easy to create amendments to an existing motion. To do this, the paragraph to be changed is selected and modified. The amendment appears in a difference view (red=deletion, green=addition). This makes the changes transparent and immediately visible to everyone. If the change request is accepted, the change is copied directly to the original request.
Auch Satzungsänderungsanträge sind mit O: Amendments to the articles of association are also possible with OpenSlides. For this purpose, the complete statutes need to be saved as sections in OpenSlides. After selecting a section, the text is modified and submitted as a new statute amendment - with automatic change display.
Mündliche Änderungsanträge oder andere a: Oral amendments or other ad-hoc changes to a motion text can be visualized in OpenSlides in form of so-called "change recommendations". For this purpose, the proposal administrator stores a modification for a specific line. This modification is immediately visible to all participants in the motion view. It is also possible to switch between the original version and the modified version at any time.
Entscheidend für virtuelle Versammlungen: A decisive factor for virtual meetings is the possibility of secure, electronic voting. For this purpose, OpenSlides version 3.2 or higher offers live voting for motions and elections. The chairperson of the meeting can choose between voting by name or not.
In beiden Fällen nutzen die stimmberecht: In both cases, the participants entitled to vote use their personal OpenSlides login to cast their vote. This ensures that only those persons who are entitled to vote may vote. And that each of these persons may only vote once. OpenSlides also allows for individual voting weighting per eligible voter.
Bei der namentlichen Stimmabgabe werden: When voting by name, the individual votes cast are stored together with the respective account. This means that at the end of the voting process, everyone can see who voted and how. This so-called "single vote proof" lists all votes with the respective vote in a table and thus offers full transparency and traceability of an open vote. The name assignment can be made anonymous later for the archive, if required. The following figure shows the result of a roll-call vote with individual votes.
Für eine nicht-namentliche Abstimmung, b: For an anonymous vote, where members can track their own votes, a roll call vote with pseudonymous accounts would be possible. This possibility is explained in the case of non-nominal voting.
Bei der nicht-namentlichen Stimmabgabe w: In the case of voting without name, only those who have cast their vote will be saved. In addition, all votes cast are counted in a virtual ballot box. However, it is not stored who has voted how. Therefore, there is no assignable list with names and votes. A direct traceability of electronic voting in OpenSlides is therefore not possible. The following illustration shows the result of a non-nominal vote on a motion (without proof of individual votes).
<strong>Wichtig anzumerken:</strong> Ein: Please note: Voting without a name in OpenSlides does not meet the requirements of a secret ballot, because administrators (i.e. people with administration rights on the OpenSlides server and sufficient technical understanding in evaluating server logs) could track the receipt of individual votes and possibly assign the transmitted vote to a session ID and thus a name. This results from the requirement that it must be checked whether users are entitled to vote and this can only be determined on the basis of a valid login. In addition, it must be checked whether participants have already cast their vote in order to prevent double voting.
Eine Alternative ist die <strong>pseudon: An alternative is pseudonymous voting: Members are given two accesses to OpenSlides - a personalized access to put themselves on the list of speakers or to make proposals and pseudonymous access to vote and be able to vote anonymously. The pseudonymous accesses have randomly generated user names and are drawn by lot to the members. Only the group of pseudonymous accesses is then allowed to vote. The advantage of this procedure is that only the person entitled to vote using his or her own pseudonym can understand and check his or her own voting. It is much more difficult to draw conclusions about who has voted and how by using pseudonyms. However, it should be explicitly pointed out once again that this is a pseudonym procedure and thus no absolute anonymity of the votes is guaranteed. As explained in the legal basis: if a secret ballot is required, the procedure of postal voting should be considered.

Dear {name},

Thank you for your request for an offer for OpenSlides! We will process your message as soon as possible.
